unusual_spending_patterns.description: Large cash withdrawals on consecutive days (September 1-2) totaling 2140.00
Significant single purchase of 1031.70 at Model Melkwinkel on September 1

insights.description: Cash withdrawals account for a significant portion (67.90%) of total expenses, which may indicate a lack of tracking for cash spending.
There is a large single shopping expense (21.36% of total spending) at Model Melkwinkel, which could be an unusual or one-time purchase.
Bank fees, while small individually, add up to a noticeable amount (1.43% of total spending).
Income is primarily received through banking app payments, suggesting a consistent source of funds.

recommendations.description: Consider using a debit card for more purchases to better track spending and reduce cash withdrawals.
Review the large shopping expense at Model Melkwinkel to determine if it was a necessary purchase or if similar expenses can be avoided in the future.
Look into ways to reduce bank fees, such as maintaining a minimum balance or switching to an account with lower fees.
Create a budget based on the identified spending categories to better manage expenses and increase savings.
Consider setting up automatic transfers to a savings account to build an emergency fund and improve overall financial health.
